column4: Brazil's Kroton close to clinching $1.7 billion deal for Estácio
column5: SAO PAULO/BRASILIA Estácio Participações SA  said on Friday its board accepted an improved takeover bid from larger rival Kroton Educacional SA  worth 5.5 billion reais ($1.7 billion)  in a step toward ending a month-long battle for Brazil's No. 2 for-profit college operator.

column4: U.S. oil drillers add rigs for 4th week in five -Baker Hughes
column5: July 1 U.S. drillers this week added oil rigs for a fourth week in five  according to a closely followed report Friday  in the best month of producers returning to the well pad since August that signaled a near-two year rout in drilling may have ended.     Drillers added 11 oil rigs in the week to July 1  bringing the total rig count up to 341  compared with 640 a year ago  energy services firm Baker Hughes Inc said. column4: Will 'Halo' shine for Apple or VirnetX?
column5: The U.S. Supreme Court's recent decision in Halo v. Pulse Electronics should hurt  not help  VirnetX's quest to build on a federal jury's $625 million patent-infringement verdict against Apple Inc.  according to a brief Apple filed in federal court on Wednesday.
